title: Easily Download and Install FFmpeg on a Windows PC

steps.title: Install 7-Zip.
steps.content: Install 7-Zip. If you don't have 7-Zip already installed, you'll need it to be able to extract the FFmpeg files. This tool is free, and you can download it from https://www.7-zip.org . Once you've downloaded the installer, double-click the downloaded file, then follow the on-screen instructions to install.

steps.title: Go to https://www.gyan.dev/ffmpeg/builds.
steps.content: Go to https://www.gyan.dev/ffmpeg/builds . This page hosts the precompiled FFmpeg binary files you'll need for Windows. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the release builds link.
steps.content: Click the release builds link. You'll see this in the left panel.

steps.title: Click the link to download ffmpeg-release-full.7z.
steps.content: Click the link to download ffmpeg-release-full.7z . The full text of the link is https://www.gyan.dev/ffmpeg/builds/ffmpeg-release-full.7z . This link downloads the latest FFmpeg files to your PC in a compressed format.

steps.title: Extract the downloaded file.
steps.content: Extract the downloaded file. Here's how: Right-click the Windows/Start button and select File Explorer . Click the Downloads folder in the left panel (you may have to click This PC first to find it). Right-click the file that begins with "ffmpeg" and ends with ".7z." (Windows 11 only) Click Show more options . Select the 7-Zip menu and click Extract Here . This creates a new folder with the same name as the .7z file .

steps.title: Rename the extracted folder FFmpeg.
steps.content: Rename the extracted folder FFmpeg . To do this: Right-click the folder. If you're using Windows 10, click Rename . If you have Windows 11, click the icon of an "A" followed by a cursor at the bottom of the menu. Type FFmpeg and press Enter .

steps.title: Click the FFmpeg folder once and press Control+X.
steps.content: Click the FFmpeg folder once and press Control + X . This "cuts" the folder from the Downloads folder so you can paste it into the root of your hard drive.

steps.title: Click This PC in File Explorer.
steps.content: Click This PC in File Explorer. It's the computer icon in the left panel.

steps.title: Click your hard drive.
steps.content: Click your hard drive. It's usually called "Windows (C:)" or "OS (C:)," but the name and drive letter may vary.

steps.title: Right-click a blank area of the right panel and select Paste.
steps.content: Right-click a blank area of the right panel and select Paste . This moves the folder to the root of your hard drive.

steps.title: Open Command Prompt as an administrator
steps.content: Open Command Prompt as an administrator . To do this, just type cmd into the Windows search bar, right-click Command Prompt , select Run as administrator , and then click Yes .

steps.title: Add FFmpeg to your system path.
steps.content: Add FFmpeg to your system path . To do this from the command line, type or paste setx /m PATH "C:\ffmpeg\bin;%PATH%" and press Enter . [2] X Research source When you're finished, close the Command Prompt window. You've now installed FFmpeg and set the proper environment variables. To confirm that FFmpeg is working, open a new command prompt window, type ffmpeg -version , and then press Enter .
